English (United States)(en-US): What were you doing, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 뭐 하고 있었어?

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing. Just looking at myself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그냥. 내 몸을 바라보고 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Beyond this black abyss of nothingness.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무것도 보이지 않는 이 검정 너머를.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve been meaning to ask.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 궁금한 게 있어. 그때는\n차마 더 물어보지 못했지만….

English (United States)(en-US): Why do you hate your\nblackness so much?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 네 검정을 왜 그렇게 미워하는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): eng1
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 이제는 말해 줄 수 있을 것만 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Hate isn’t the right\nword for this emotion.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사실, 미워한다는 표현과는\n상응하지 않는 감정이야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s something much more impure.\nGrubby. Something that runs deep.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 보다 불순물 가득하고, 농도\n짙으며, 청결하지 못하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Crude and noiseless.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조악하고 소리 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): Some days it creeps upward\nbefore sinking down,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어느 날은 스멀스멀 기어오르다\n가라앉을 때도 있고,

English (United States)(en-US): and other days it wraps around me and\n swallows me whole, wet and slimy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어느 날은 온몸을 휘감으며 날 집어삼켰다가,\n타액 같이 질척한 잔여감을 남기기도 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Disgust?|Fear?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혐오인 거야?|공포인 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Correct and incorrect.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 둘 다 정확하면서 부정확해.

English (United States)(en-US): Revulsion, distaste, hostility? Fear, self-hatred,\nloathing. No, no. Perhaps all of the above.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혐오, 공포. 불쾌함, 적개심? 자학, 미움.\n아니, 아니야. 그 모든 것일수도 있겠지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But no word in the dictionary could\nbe enough to express how I feel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사전 속 어떤 단어로도 나의\n이 감정을 표현하기에는 부족해.

English (United States)(en-US): I think I understand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 수 있겠다고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): (I know how they feel. Be empathetic.)|(Try to make Dot see differently.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (무슨 마음인지 알아. 공감한다.)|(뭉치의 생각을 바꿔 보려고 한다.)

English (United States)(en-US): eng2
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나 역시 스스로를 바라보며\n혐오를 느낄 때가 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): eng3
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가장 최근의 경험을 이야기하자면,

English (United States)(en-US): eng4
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 위로가 될지는 모르겠지만…

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t understand why you hate it so much.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 뭉치야, 그렇게까지\n싫어하는 이유를 잘 모르겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): eng5-1|eng5-2
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구에서는 검정이 나쁘기만 한 색은 아니야.|나는 검정색을 좋아해. 당연 너의 검정도.

English (United States)(en-US): eng6
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 검정을 멋지고 매력적인\n색으로 여기는 경우가 많아.

English (United States)(en-US): eng7
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검정을 가만히 보고 있으면 마음이\n가라앉으면서 편안해지기도 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): eng8
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들이 좋아하는 검정은 ‘나의’\n검정과 달라. 그것은 그저 색소잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): eng9-1|eng9-2
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (머뭇거린다)|뭉치의 검정도 결국은 색소 아니야?

English (United States)(en-US): I like your blackness. It’s special and unique.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검정은 특별하고 개성 있잖아. 멋지고 고요해.\n그만의 강렬한 매력이 존재하거든.

English (United States)(en-US): eng10
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검정을 가만히 보고 있으면 마음이\n가라앉으면서 편안해지기도 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): > But it’s so very you. Small but clever, a lovely ball of black!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 같아. 작지만 똑똑하고,\n사랑스러운 ‘검정’ 덩어리!

English (United States)(en-US): eng11
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 문장의 모든 요소가 빠짐없이\n너다운걸. 특히 검다는 수식이 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): eng12
eng13
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 나의 집의 구석을 점령한 ‘파스텔톤의’\n작은 덩어리든, 지금처럼 시커먼 덩어리든,

English (United States)(en-US): eng14
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나에게 너는 그냥 너야.\n그리고 난 뭉치의 검정이 좋아.

English (United States)(en-US): eng15
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치가 말이 없네….)

English (United States)(en-US): You like my black?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘나의 검정’이 좋다고?

English (United States)(en-US): …… <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): eng16
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너나 다른 인간들이 검정을 어떻게 바라보며\n어떻게 인식하든, 그것은 나와 상관 없는 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): It doesn’t disgust me from my very core,\nnor does it taint you from your very soul.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 검정은 나를 단전부터 징그럽게 하지도,\n너를 영혼부터 오염시키지도 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): You really had no idea?\nThis whole time?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 검정과 다른 검정들은 다르다니까.\n그걸 정말 모르고 있던 거야? 줄곧?

English (United States)(en-US): eng17
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건.

English (United States)(en-US): This is rancid vomit, shameful\ninferiority… squirming cockroaches.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 썩어 버린 토사물, 더러운 열등감 덩어리…\n꿈틀거리는 바퀴벌레.

English (United States)(en-US): Think. Think about it\nfrom a human perspective.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 생각해 봐. 인간으로서 생각해 보란 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Imagine you’re made of them, and you smell\nthem every time you look at yourself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 몸뚱아리가 그들로부터 구성되고,\n네 몸을 볼 때마다 그들의 냄새가 난다고.

English (United States)(en-US): Isn’t it disgusting? Revolting?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불쾌하지 않아? 혐오스럽지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): Aren’t you seized with the urge to\npeel off your skin layer by layer?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당장이라도 네 몸을 한 겹\n한 겹 긁어 내고 싶지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): To chop it off?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘라 버리고 싶지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): A bathtub… or just plain old bleach.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 욕조… 어쩌면 락스.

English (United States)(en-US): Don’t you want to submerge yourself in anything\nand pray pray pray that it purifies you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐든 좋으니 잠겨서 제발 제발 제발 제발\n정화될 수 있기를 빌게 되지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, oh, oh. Oh….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 아, 아. 아….

English (United States)(en-US): If you’d been born from filth, from the foulest\nand largest pool on the dark side of the moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달 뒤편의 가장 추악하고 거대한 웅덩이가\n가진 ‘더러움’ 속에서 네가 태어났다면.

English (United States)(en-US): Then you wouldn’t be able to say these words so easily.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그랬더라면 네가 지금 같은 말을 그다지도 \n쉽사리 내뱉을 수 있었을까.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야….

English (United States)(en-US): You’re pitying me but you have\nno idea what it’s really like.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 아니. 그만 둬. 그건 얄팍한 연민이야.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re being arrogant, thinking\nyou can fix anything. You can’t.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 편협한 오만이고.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought you would understand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너라면 내 마음을 알 줄 알았어.

English (United States)(en-US): No, no, no.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 아니, 아니지.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe you can’t understand,\nbecause you’re you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너라서 내 마음을 모르는 것일지도.

English (United States)(en-US): And you could never be me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘너’는 근본적으로 ‘내’가 될 수 없으니.

English (United States)(en-US): Because you’re human.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 인간이고.

English (United States)(en-US): And I’m…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는…

English (United States)(en-US): I’m.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는.

English (United States)(en-US): A monster.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괴물이니.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t want to see you right now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당장은 너를 보고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Leave. Please.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나가 주면 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, is it special to be unique?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 유일하면 특별해?

English (United States)(en-US): Is being unique a good thing?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 유일하면 좋아?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, it’s a valuable thing.|Depends on what kind of unique.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 유일하단 건 가치가 있다는 거야.|어떤 유일인지에 따라 다르겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Are you sure?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과연 그럴까?

English (United States)(en-US): I see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 역시 그렇구나.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I envy you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 난 네가 부러워.

English (United States)(en-US): Everywhere you go you have your\nspecies staring back like a mirror.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어딜 가나 너를 닮은 너의 종족들이\n거울처럼 너를 바라보고 있잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): On a walk in the park near your house, or\non some hidden beach in a faraway land,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 집 앞 공원에 산책을 가도, 머나먼\n나라의 숨겨진 해변가에 가도,

English (United States)(en-US): your species resemble you and\nassure you exist as a human being.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 널 닮은 너의 종족들은 동질감을\n넘어 너라는 존재에 대한 확신을 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): He, she, and them, here\nand there and every where.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너랑 닮은 그도, 그녀도, 그들도 여기\n있고, 쟤도 얘도 모두가 여기 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): They all look like you, and their\nlives interlace with yours like a net.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다들 너랑 비슷한 모양을 하고,\n그물처럼 엮이고 엮이며 살아가.

English (United States)(en-US): Assurance. That I too can and should\nexist. Not a coincidence, but a fact.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 확신. 그렇다면 나 또한 이곳에 존재하는\n게 옳구나. 우연이 아닌 당연.

English (United States)(en-US): Exist. That my existence in itself grants me\nthe right to make up part of this universe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 존재. 그저 존재함으로서\n세상을 구성할 자격이 있구나.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a privilege only\nthose with kin are given.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 마음을 느낄 수 있는 건\n동족 있는 자들의 특권일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot is right. They’ve always been a source of comfort.)|(But are they always good for you?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (맞아, 동족의 존재는 나에게 위안이 됐어.)|(과연 ‘동족’이 좋기만 한 존재들일까?)

English (United States)(en-US): One could think that. I agree with you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 생각할 수 있지. 공감해.

English (United States)(en-US): Humans… are like one another\nin each and every unique way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은… 어쩌면 전부 달라 보이는\n방식으로 비슷한 존재들이거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Wholesome happiness is shared\nwith others in a ecstatic roar,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 온전한 기쁨은 타인과 함께\n나누며 환호하기도 하고,

English (United States)(en-US): while a stranger’s word can soothe\nover the deepest caverns of sorrow.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깊은 슬픔의 굴에 혼자 빠졌을 때에는\n타인의 한 마디에 위로받기도 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): The fact that someone shares my\nemotions and perspective alone
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나와 동일한 감정과 시각을 가지고\n있는 존재가 있다는 사실만으로도

English (United States)(en-US): can at times give me confidence\nin myself, and my existence.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자연스레 나라는 존재에 대한\n확신이 들 때가 있는 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): I see……. I knew it. I was right.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나……. 역시 그런\n거였어. 나의 생각이 맞았어.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you see, I envy\nthat loose thread of connection.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 나는, 있지,\n그 느슨한 소속의 감각이 미칠 듯 부러운 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s not always a good thing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 생각보다 좋지 않을 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Being similar means being subjected to\ncomparison, evaluation, or projection.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 비슷한 모양을 하고 있기 때문에 더욱\n쉽게 비교나 평가, 투영의 대상이 되지.

English (United States)(en-US): The more people look like you,\nthe easier you can be replaced.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 닮은 사람이 많다는 건, 그만큼\n쉽게 대체될 수 있다는 뜻이기도 하고.

English (United States)(en-US): You might lose faith in your existence,\nand even your individuality.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 존재에 대한 확신, 나아가 너의\n고유성마저 잃어버릴 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Losing, or forgetting…. whichever\nit may be I’ll never know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잃는 것인지, 잊는 것인지….\n무엇인지는 정확히 알 수 없겠지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But it’s tiring and scary to have beings\nthat share my emotions and perspectives.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나와 동일한 감정과 시각을 가지고 있는\n존재가 있다는 건 피곤하고 두려운 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I even wanted all of them to go away.|That’s why I don’t like people very much.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한때는 그들이 모두 사라지기를 바라기도 했어.|그래서 난 인간들을 그다지 좋아하지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Really?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말?

English (United States)(en-US): Humans… as peculiar\nas they are beautiful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은… 아름다운 만큼\n오묘한 존재들이구나.

English (United States)(en-US): That even you can sometimes\nbe tired of your kin.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 따뜻한 <nickname>조차 동족을\n이따금씩 지겨워한다니.

English (United States)(en-US): But…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만…

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t stop thinking how that sentiment\nis yet another privilege for those with kin.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 감상 또한 동족 있는 자들의\n특권이라는 생각을 지울 수가 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): I.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는.

English (United States)(en-US): So I.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 나는.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m unique anywhere I go.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 어딜 가도 유일해.

English (United States)(en-US): One of a kind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오직 하나밖에 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): They call beings like me a ‘rarity’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이걸 ‘희귀하다’고 한대.

English (United States)(en-US): Like a pink diamond from the desert,\nor a baby’s first tooth, solid and white.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사막에서 나오는 핑크 다이아몬드처럼,\n누군가의 단단하고 새하얀 첫 이빨처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): To be rare should mean to be beautiful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 희귀하면 아름다워야 하는데.

English (United States)(en-US): And desirable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래야지 모두가 원할 텐데.

English (United States)(en-US): But why am I like this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 왜 이럴까.

English (United States)(en-US): Small and sticky and mouthless and\ncolorless and kinless and useless
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 작고 끈적거리고 입도 없고\n색깔도 없고 동족도 없고 쓸모없고

English (United States)(en-US): useless
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 쓸모없고

English (United States)(en-US): useless
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 쓸모없고

English (United States)(en-US): and no one wants me. Like a nasty piece of\ncandy, stuck to the bottom of a picnic basket.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또 누구도 먹기 싫어해. 바구니 밑바닥에\n남아 햇빛에 녹고 눌러붙는 이상한 맛의 사탕처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야….

English (United States)(en-US): I’m unique.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 유일해.

English (United States)(en-US): One of a kind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하나뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Singular because no one needs me,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무도 필요로 하지 않기 때문에\n하나밖에 존재하지 않는,

English (United States)(en-US): like a leftover. With no\nright to this universe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나머지 같은 존재.\n세상을 구성할 자격이 없는.

English (United States)(en-US): …. Lonely. I think I’m lonely.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …. 외로워. 외로운 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): I can only ever be me
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 나밖에 될 수 없고

English (United States)(en-US): and you can only ever be you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 너밖에 될 수 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): I know, I know, I know! But! I think I’ve found\nthe sole exception, where we can be one!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 알아, 알아, 알아! 알지만! 예외를 찾은 것 같아,\n너와 내가 통할 수도 있다는 예외를!

English (United States)(en-US): (Look at Dot.)|(Inquire.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치를 그저 바라본다.)|(의문한다.)

English (United States)(en-US): What exception?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 예외?

English (United States)(en-US): It has to do with this book I read today!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 어떤 책을 읽었거든!

English (United States)(en-US): The protagonist was a monster just like me,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 책 속 주인공도 나와 같은 괴물이었는데,

English (United States)(en-US): and we were alike in many ways,\nand so were our thought processes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 닮은 점이 아주 많았고,\n생각하는 방식도 비슷했어.

English (United States)(en-US): The way he thought and felt,\nfeared, rejoiced, and questioned.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 감정과 생각의 흐름, 그의\n두려움, 기쁨, 의문까지.

English (United States)(en-US): All of it was a carbon copy of every\nsingle voice flowing within me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 안에서 유체처럼 떠도는 모든 울림을\n있는 그대로 빼다 박아 놓은 것 같았지.

English (United States)(en-US): Even his hatred toward himself\nfelt like my very own.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그가 자신을 보며 느끼던 혐오감까지도,\n진정 나의 그것 같았어.

English (United States)(en-US): And I, oh, oh, oh—! I felt my heart\ncry out… and I resonated with him!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 이렇게, 아, 아, 아-! 심장이 부르짖는\n감각을 느끼며… 그와 공명할 수 있었다고!

English (United States)(en-US): I was him!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 곧 ‘내’가 되었던 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): But Dot, you said before that we’re separate \nbeings that could never be one, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만 뭉치, 너와 나는 각자의 존재로,\n결코 하나가 될 수 없다고 하지 않았어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I did.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그랬었지.

English (United States)(en-US): But no! Really? Really, truly? No!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 설마! 진짜? 진짜 그럴까? 설마!

English (United States)(en-US): But despite knowing it to be true, the mere \nthought made my heart ache with desolation,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 알면서도 정말이지 그 사실을\n생각하면 심장이 허망하게 사무쳐서

English (United States)(en-US): so I was searching for clues, exceptions\nthat will exclaim, “Preposterous!”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘이 생각은 아주 틀렸어!’라고 외칠 수 있는\n단서, 예외들을 찾아 나서는 중이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): If there truly is no exception, am I doomed\nto the fundamental solitude of existence,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 예외가 세상에 단 하나라도 없다면, 나는\n그렇게 존재의 근본적인 고독을 느끼며

English (United States)(en-US): abandoned and left alone to slowly dry out?\nNo, not a chance. Seek the exception I shall!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 홀로 버려진 채 서서히 메말라 버리지 않을까?\n아니, 그럴 수 없지. 예외를 찾아야지!

English (United States)(en-US): The way you searched for characters\nin books that resemble you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 너와 닮았다고 느껴지는 책\n속 인물들을 찾아 다닌 것처럼?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m not just bound to me, and\nyou’re not just bound to you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 나밖에 못 되고,\n너는 너밖에 못 되는 게 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): We can be each other!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 서로가 될 수 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): But he’s only a character from a book.|Can a man-made monster back your logic, though?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 그는 그저 책 속의 인물일 뿐인걸.|다만 창작된 괴물 캐릭터가 좋은 예시일까?

English (United States)(en-US): They exist as print on the pages of a book.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 활자와 책의 표면으로 존재해,

English (United States)(en-US): They don’t contain multitudes, they don’t live\nor breathe, and they don’t interact with you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 입체감 있는 자아나 주체를\n가진 인간과는 다르지.

English (United States)(en-US): You might have been deeply\ntouched by reading that book,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 적혀진 글을 읽고\n깊이 공감했을 수 있겠지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but the way you resonated… might just\nbe you projecting a piece of you onto him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 하나처럼 공명한 건… 그저 그에게\n투영된 너의 조각 중 하나가 아닐까.

English (United States)(en-US): But…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만…

English (United States)(en-US): But.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만.

English (United States)(en-US): In that moment I felt whole…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 그 순간만큼은 충만해졌는걸.…

English (United States)(en-US): (Pat Dot.)|(Look at Dot.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치를 조용히 쓰다듬는다.)|(뭉치를 조용히 바라본다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Was it a moment of fulfillment,\na moment of illusion?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 찰나의 만끽, 찰나의 착각이었던 걸까.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, oh…. All unique beings are inevitably\nlonely. I know, I know, I know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 아…. 모든 고유한 존재들에는\n필연적인 외로움이 있어. 알아. 알아. 알아.

English (United States)(en-US): I know, I know it has to be so, and yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 알면서도, 그럴 수밖에 없다는 걸 알면서도,

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a wall I desperately want to\ntear down. I thirst, and I desire.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건 격렬히 깨 부수고 싶은 벽이야.\n갈증이고, 갈망이야.

English (United States)(en-US): (Stay by Dot’s side.)|(Give Dot some space.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (조용히 옆에 있어 준다.)|(뭉치에게 혼자만의 시간을 준다.)

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, look over here!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 여길 봐!

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응?

English (United States)(en-US): What do you think?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어때?

English (United States)(en-US): (Oh, shit. A bug.)|(Gah! What is that!)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (오, 젠장. 벌레다.)|(히익! 이게 뭐야!)

English (United States)(en-US): Oh… a bug.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 앗… 벌레구나.

English (United States)(en-US): What are you doing with a bug, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어째서 벌레와 함께 있는 거야, 뭉치?

English (United States)(en-US): (Please, please get away from it.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (얼른, 제발 떨어지라고 말하고 싶다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, it’s a present from Dame Spider\nthat lives on our windowsill!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 우리 집 창문에 살고 있는\n거미 선생이 선물해 준 벌레야!

English (United States)(en-US): I think humans call this a ‘caterpillar’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 ‘애벌레’라고 부르는 것 같던데.

English (United States)(en-US): Look at it. It’s plump\nand long and flexible.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 애벌레의 몸을 봐. 통통하고 길고 유연해.

English (United States)(en-US): Just how many places has it\nbeen to with its wriggling body?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 꿈틀거리는 몸으로 얼마나\n많은 곳을 다녀왔을까?

English (United States)(en-US): It must have visited the corner store, the local\ngraveyard, and your favorite diner easily.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 창문 밖으로 보이는 편의점, 동네 묘지, 네가 가장\n좋아하는 식당까지 무리 없이 다녀왔을 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): (I guess that sounds pretty…cute?)|(Blegh… It gives me the creeps.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (상상하니 나름… 귀여운걸?)|(윽… 소름 돋아.)

English (United States)(en-US): Yeah… I guess….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응… 그럴 수도 있겠다….

English (United States)(en-US): I want to hear what it has to say.\nIt must be like an adventure novel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 애벌레의 이야기들을 꼭 듣고 싶어.\n모험 소설 같을 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US):
I like to think this caterpillar is a lovable\n
prankster who likes to get up to mischief.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 애벌레가 여기저기 괜한 훼방을\n놓는 사랑스러운 장난꾸러기일 것 같은데.

English (United States)(en-US): What do you think?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 애벌레가 어떨 것 같아?

English (United States)(en-US): (I’d rather not think about it…)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (딱히 상상하고 싶지는 않지만…)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, no!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 절대 안 되지!

English (United States)(en-US): Diners don’t allow bugs!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 식당에 벌레가 있으면 어떡해!

English (United States)(en-US): Why not? Caterpillars get hungry too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜? 애벌레도 배가 고플 수 있잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): What would be the best\ndish for our little friend here?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 생각하는 최고의 메뉴를\n이 친구에게 추천해 주는 건 어때?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, um…. the best dish?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 어…. 최고의 메뉴?

English (United States)(en-US): Uh, I guess I’d say…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 애벌레를 위한 메뉴는…

English (United States)(en-US): … I like it!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 마음에 꼭 들어!

English (United States)(en-US): You know,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있잖아,

English (United States)(en-US): I’m on closer terms with Dame\nSpider, wouldn’t you say?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 거미 선생과 조금은 더 친해진 것 같지?

English (United States)(en-US): I always said hello to her\nafter our first encounter,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 처음 스쳤던 이후로 마주칠 때마다 인사했는데,

English (United States)(en-US): but she didn’t seem to recognize me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 선생은 나를 잘 못 알아보는 것 같더라고.

English (United States)(en-US): And it felt like a weight on my chest every time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 마음이 마치 쇳덩이로\n짓눌린 것처럼 답답했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Until today, when she dropped\nthis bug in front of me!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 오늘 갑자기 내 앞에\n이 벌레를 놓고 떠난 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): Only then did I guess how Dame Spider felt,\nthough we haven’t said a word to each other.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 마디 나눠 본 적 없어 알지 못했던 거미\n선생의 마음을 그제야 짐작할 수 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): She must think we’re closer now, and this\ncaterpillar must be a token of our friendship.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 역시 나와 조금은 친해졌다고 생각하고,\n친밀감의 증표로 애벌레를 선물한 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): I would like to be good friends with it,\nso kindly offered to me by the Dame.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 선생의 소중한 마음을 담은\n이 선물과 친한 친구가 되고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): How should I go about\nmaking friends with it? Help!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 친구와 어떻게 친해질 수 있을까? 도와줘!

English (United States)(en-US): ‘What do I do….’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘이를 어떡하지…’

English (United States)(en-US): Well… I’ll think about it…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으음… 생각해볼게…
